website_summaries.verdict: The secure fit, warmth, and durability of these diving socks are the perfect choice for diving, surfing, fishing, and other water sports- especially for adventurers living in cooler climates.
pros: Available in multiple sizes, extra-small through XXL
cons: The cost for different sizes can vary wildly
NeoSport wetsuit socks are only available in black

customer_reviews.title: Thick Sock, Fits in Fins, and Size Chart Found!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a thick neoprene bootie that I could wear as I walk over rocky surfaces, on my way out to snorkel. They are super thick and also fit into my fins. For now, very pleased. I'll update my review once I use them on my vacation in St. John next week. Also, for those who can't figure out what size to buy, I wear a shoe size of 6.5, and ordered the XS. Before doing so, I found this size chart on another site selling the bootie.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepless in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, but I only use it when I really need to
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for jet skiing in cold water. I normally just wear wrestling shoes but these would add some more warmth. I wear these as socks inside my shoes. Work extemely well. However they are a little squishy to jet ski all the time. Especially with the stand up jet skis I ride on. The little thinner socks are a little better and are also easier to fit within the same size riding shoe.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorMasterBlaster

customer_reviews.title: Good socks but they just don't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks last year to use on my visits to Zion National Park (to hike The Narrows and The Subway). Since I purchased them, I have worn them on 5 hikes and the left foot sock has a big hole in the front (by the toe). I wore these in conjunction with Columbia water shoes - so they were always enclosed and protected. Disappointing as I really liked these socks for their fit and warmth. Unfortunately, these are out of warranty and not returnable. Shop around and look at other brands before - the longevity of these socks is questionable.
customer_reviews.author: The Wandering Soul

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and thick, but a little quick to wear through
customer_reviews.text: Decent sock. Comfortable and thick, but a little too quick to wear holes through. I never walk in neoprene but after two months of about 3 drives per week, there are wear holes in the bottom of the toes. The fit was good if not slightly wide. Very cushy and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Oahu Dad

customer_reviews.title: Good Balloon feet for surfers!
customer_reviews.text: These are really warm and pretty strong but they do not work well for surfing. After a couple uses they start filling up with water and you end up with balloon feet. Best to just buy booties. These socks would probably be good for a kayaker Or less active water activity?
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: We carry these in our backpacks on long trips and use them for water crossings. They are fantastic when passing through the icy waters coming off the mountains. Keep the boots clean and dry and use these to cross instead. Sure it takes a minute to sit down and change these out for your boots, but warm and dry feet are a welcome friend when hiking.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these wetsuit socks for body boarding with Churchhill fins. You must realize that socks are not supportive by them selves and there is no sole support. You need wetsuit booties for support activities such as windsurfing, surfing, scuba diving, etc. Socks are great for protection from the fins and a little from the heel etc. So wetsuit booties or boots have some type of sole and more supportive traits. The socks are great for comfort in fins for swimming, snorkeling & body boarding. You would slip on a surf board. You get the idea. Amazon is great for searching for any product you would like. Just read reviews and have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: The XL size is a perfect fit for my size 12 feet. I work as a flyfishing guide in Alaska in the summers and these socks will allow me to wear my wading boots without the waders when I am rowing clients down whitewater rivers. Combined with wet suit shorts or pants, I can have the warmth, comfort and mobility I need and still have the ability to jump into the river without drowning.
customer_reviews.author: J JACQUES

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought these 5mm socks for physical therapy in our outdoor pool. 48 degree water and 52 degree outside temperature and it did really well along with the 7/5mm diving suit up to 3 hours in the pool. Accurate sizing. Use it every day!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Mizell

customer_reviews.title: very happy with these socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks fit perfectly in side my fin. They are more like a bootie than a sock, but there is no hard sole. It does have a hint of texture, which just may keep it from slipping. I will update my review after I take them on a boat. All in all I am very happy with them. They fit much better than the too wide soft soled boot I had bought. I have long narrow feet, women's size 9, and the medium fits me just right. It will stretch a bit more and fit a wider foot, but not terribly so.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Nice option
customer_reviews.text: Needed booties for a cold water diving. Having troubles finding foot pocket large enough to accommodate foot. When you remove the rubber soul from those booties this allows to fit.
customer_reviews.author: SMB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for LOTS of Activities
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used these: snorkeling, on float trips, weed eating (lol), and my new favorite - as booties in my motocross boots when trail riding. I am SO tired of cold wet feet when we cross one of 100 rivers in a day...and then it dawned on me...my booties! This past weekend, I slipped these babies on and went sans socks with just the booties and MX boots. On creek/river #2, my boots filled, but I could immediately tell the neoprene was going to keep me perfectly warm all day. At the end of the day as my riding buddies warmed their tootsies - my feet were just perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Orange Prop

customer_reviews.title: Good SOCKS
customer_reviews.text: I would suggest that if your planning on using a monofin please think about using these or something like these to not only provide a better fit in the foot pockets but also to prevent friction issues between your skin and the monofin. This is what my wife who is doing the mermaid thing uses these for. She swears by these
customer_reviews.author: JustaDudeTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to give me heat on runs in winter when things might get wet. Or when playing pick up soccer in cold and rain. These give me that. Thick enough for some heat, thin enough to wear with your normal shoes (laces loosened a bit). The seams are good as you can barely feel them. If you are diving or rafting in cold, something thicker than 1.5 would probably be smart. If you want to keep wet feet warm in what I would consider non-water sports (but still wet), these will do great. Also work for ice baths if that is your bag.
customer_reviews.author: Indygreg

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality and performed as expected
customer_reviews.text: It did just what I got it for, which was to have a snug fit with my full foot fins and prevent any chafing plus add a bit of thermal warmth. Very stretchy, so even though I was 1/2 size over the upper size on the sizing chart it worked very well. You really wouldn't want a baggy fitting fin sock. Haven't used it often enough yet to report on longevity, but it's thin enough to want to treat it gently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tried two pairs and left disappointed. Finally saw the light with the OMER socks!
customer_reviews.text: The tailoring is less than accurate for an actual human foot. Looks like it was drawn by a novice designer, and then never improved after trying it on! More of a cheap substitute to the better OMER socks, not a viable piece of serious dive gear. I bought two pairs of these before finally switching to OMER. Pros: -Cheap Cons: -Neoprene compresses quickly -Does not fit a foot very well, the cut is strange -The ankle height is too short, barely extending above the top of my 6 mm dive boots.
customer_reviews.author: Lowell H.

customer_reviews.title: Look as advertised so far visually
customer_reviews.text: Not tried it out yet as my trip that I got those for starts this coming Thursday and I do not need them until Monday a week from today most likely.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Stites

customer_reviews.title: Use NeoSport!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow these things keep my feet warm! I use the 5mm for freediving in California. We dive in water that's in the 50s year round so it's always cold. NeoSport is a well none brand with excellent quality so trust me it is worth the purchase every time. I have had them for a year now and it looks like they will still survive for another season of diving!
customer_reviews.author: FindingMeghan

customer_reviews.title: Show me the booties.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. My find were a bit too big, so I got these to snug them up. Worked like a charm. These are really comfortable and seem really well made. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Miller

customer_reviews.title: a small size was sent to me but surprisingly enough they worked fine. I'm going to go in the lake with ...
customer_reviews.text: Received these socks today To use in the cold lake about 50 degree water or less... I wear a size 10 and a half running shoe, so I ordered a large. a small size was sent to me but surprisingly enough they worked fine. I'm going to go in the lake with them and will update my review. I stood in my bathtub with water about 47 degrees as cold as it comes out of the faucet and I didn't feel a single thing until some water started trickling in which quickly warmed up ended up being just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Yep

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to wear my Keens as I did the year before and not be battling painful rocks from the riverbed
customer_reviews.text: These were a lifesaver on a float trip. I wanted to wear my Keens as I did the year before and not be battling painful rocks from the riverbed. I tried heavy socks last year but these things were wonderful! The seemed to fit perfectly under my Keens keeping medium, small and tiny rocks out or at least I didn't feel them with my sensitive feet!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie C

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I like the item. Well made. Material seems to be good quality. Fits a little loose but, that's fine with me. I was looking for that type of fit. I am size 8-1//2 shoe just to help with reference. Good item. Good buyer. Would buy again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Curry

customer_reviews.title: Warm and quality made
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots very warm and so far after about 6 wearings no signs of wear. Speaking of warm they are almost too warm my feet sweat in these.I use them for cold sand volleyball courts and I live in AZ. My only grumble with them is sand does get in around the ankle. I probably should have ordered a medium instead of a large(shoe size is 11). Overall I'd buy them again versus a 2mm sand sock which I owned previously and wore out in 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: dtforvb

customer_reviews.title: It was a great 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Started out great. The 5mm soles of these things really helped when I was at beaches that didn't have the smoothest sand. But after 3 or 4 uses, I noticed a hole by the big toe of one of them. I didn't think they'd last forever, but I was really hoping to get more use out of them than a few days. On the plus side, they lasted twice as long as the 2mm soles I purchased last time! Fml Spend the extra money! Get a pair that will last!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Great Scuba Fine Socks!
customer_reviews.text: I have these in 2mm a drink decided to get the 5mm for my up coming trip. On the 2mm, the plastic tred/anti-slip material came off after about 10 dives. These are great for use with fins and keeps your feet warm when diving.
customer_reviews.author: tmkrnlp

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last very long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in the hope of not getting stung during the current jellyfish bloom we're having. They arrived on time, fit well, so I paddled out with them on... After about 4 to 5 hours of decent waves, both of them had holes on the ball of the foot. Not tiny holes, but holes that my big toes kept getting through. On the plus side, they didn't let the stingers get through. But if you want durability, keep looking. Don't think those big holes are gonna keep the heat in, either.
customer_reviews.author: Kris DuBose

customer_reviews.title: Keep feet warm - which is all I asked for
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear when I go hiking in a low level creek during the winter months, the water gets a little chilly cause the creek is at a high elevation - In AZ they work just fine, feet were not cold at all.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica8

customer_reviews.title: Wetsuit socks.
customer_reviews.text: Product advertised as it says. I bought these socks to keep my feet warm and dry for the winter season. It haven*t rain hard enough to prove its waterproof qualities yet. My feet is a size 8 1\2 single wide. The socks I ordered is size medium [ 8-9 ] . It fits snugly and it doesn*t feel tight to warrant discomfort. It*s breatheable and doesn*t leave my feet sweaty. I would recommend these socks to everyone for indoor and outdoor activities.
customer_reviews.author: 808TREX50

customer_reviews.title: I used them 10/31/15 so the water is pretty chilly this time of year
customer_reviews.text: got these for my hike through the Narrows in Zion National Park. I used them 10/31/15 so the water is pretty chilly this time of year. These things kept me warm! Hike mates wore wool socks and were complaining a whole lot about how cold it was. 5mm keeps you warm as well as extra cushion for hiking through that tough terrain through the waters!
customer_reviews.author: Pablorce

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the feet warm
customer_reviews.text: Need to keep my feet warm while cold weather dinghy sailing. I got 1 size too big so it doesn't squeeze circulation and does the job very well.
customer_reviews.author: JACK KEDZIE

customer_reviews.title: Great socks for open heel fins-no more chaffing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the NeoSport Socks to be worn with Open heel fins. My shoe size is W8 and the socks in size S fitted me perfectly. The socks are thin enough to be worn with the fins so that they fit snugly. The rubberized grip in the bottom also kept them from moving around. No more chaffing from fins and I did not have to worry too much about some sand between the fins and my feet. I had a great time snorkeling in the Maldives!
customer_reviews.author: Corgi

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the boot fits feels great, high quality at a good price. Wish they sold 3 in a pair being I have 3 feet at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Creed bradden

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: These have been great. The stitching is still holding tight after 3 yrs of once a month use. It would be nice if they were taller, but then they would need zippers to get on and off. Without the zippers they are warmer and more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Steve P. Price

customer_reviews.title: Great companion
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly in California where diving can be cold and surfing just fine. I wear the socks inside my boots during diving and only one when surfing.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great for canyoneering...although a tiny bit too big
customer_reviews.text: I wear at womens 9 in athletic shoes and the mediums were a little big for me. Not enough to worry TOO much about...I end up with a little bunching but it doesn't cause an issue. I don't know that the small would have fit. My feet stay SO much warmer than with my 2mm wet socks that I used to have.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought these socks!
customer_reviews.text: I swim in my outdoor pool all year round. These socks keep my feet toasty warm even when the water is ice cold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never worried about my feet.
customer_reviews.text: They work very well. Used them canyoneering in Utah with 5.10 water tennies. Couldn't have been happier. Then used them again to hike the narrows the next day. Never had to give my feet a second thought. (Though strongly recommend the shoes as well)
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Wears out quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Product was good for about a dozen outings. Then seam came undone. (See pic)
customer_reviews.author: Jeff F

customer_reviews.title: My legs are fine, but my feet get really cold
customer_reviews.text: I take my dog to the lake for him to swim 3 to 4 times a week. I go in with him, but in winter months, the water is really cold. My legs are fine, but my feet get really cold. I bought a thinner pair last year and it worked ok. These work great. It is almost pleasant to go in the lake wearing these
customer_reviews.author: Brice Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Not for kite boarding
customer_reviews.text: I purchased those for kite boarding. Easy to put in( I am size 9.5 ) but when they got wet they become loosy. They ripped open in the first few minutes. Had no chance but to return.
customer_reviews.author: Roumen

customer_reviews.title: My opinion, terribly worded.
customer_reviews.text: This is very comfortable, no complaints there, however, I underestimated the sizing and bought a large. The large is actually quite small, so I ordered an X-Large. they are really good, very comfortable and amazing grip. Not much else to say.
customer_reviews.author: Efraim Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.. I use these for my surfski where ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good.. I use these for my surfski where i don't won't to wear a 5ml booty .. they are thin but that's what i won't i'm careful not to be all over the pavement or rocks with them...
customer_reviews.author: D...

customer_reviews.title: What a joke- deceiving photo
customer_reviews.text: These socks are nothing like the photo- a cheap Chinese made product that is NOT a sock. Large and loose in places where it shouldn't be.
customer_reviews.author: mmDC

customer_reviews.title: Great for stones and the "ick" factor of Lake Erie
customer_reviews.text: My triathlon club does our OWS in Lake Erie. There are lots of sharp stones on the beach and under the water, not to mention the seaweed and dead fish that you like to pretend you never step on. Who cares when you've got these on? It's also fun when you take them off and they're all full of water. it's like taking water balloons off your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Name withheld because stalkers Google me and I find it annoying

customer_reviews.title: Soft and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I don't know much about surfing. I do however, really like my neosport socks, which I use when I go. They keep my feet warm in the Northern Cal ocean waves (about 50 degrees F). The bottoms won't last long if you have to walk long distances. If the ankles were tighter I would have given it five stars. Then again, I have really skinny ankles.
customer_reviews.author: Lee in Riverside

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Keep my feet warm in cold weather on my stand up paddle board!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pooser

customer_reviews.title: Great sox
customer_reviews.text: I got these for kayaking. When kayaking you always get your feet wet when launching the boat and if its cold outside, your feet stay cold. Not with these bad boys. Good quality and would definitely recommend and buy again. Only complaint is that there is no size chart when you buy them. I wear size 13 shoes so I ordered the XXL and they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Egully

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed, the glue along the seams skinned my ankle ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, the glue along the seams skinned my ankle the first time I tried it on. The glue was very hard and very uncomfortable along all the seamed linings. I will be returning. Too bad because the thickness was just perfect for my 5.10 canyoneering boot.
customer_reviews.author: amazonbuyer

customer_reviews.title: ... my Simms Oceantek boots for wet wading and works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to wear with my Simms Oceantek boots for wet wading and works like a charm. A little loose but nothing that causes discomfort or lose footing. Just rinse and air dry each side and good to go every weekend when needed.
customer_reviews.author: GARRIGA

customer_reviews.title: Warm dry and surprisingly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Got the 5mm for added warmth and insulation for some surf fishing in cold water. Thought the extra thick seams around the sole would be uncomfortable but it really wasn't a problem. Didn't wear any other liner, just the XSpan socks and some bootfoot chest waders. Feet stayed warm and dry, even with a little perspiration. What more can I say.
customer_reviews.author: PB_in_NW

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Used them to sea kayak. You should know that they don't keep your feet dry, but they do keep them warm. They take a long time to dry unless you put them near some dry heat.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Nice Socks
customer_reviews.text: I have a size 10 foot and bought the L. They fit snugly, which is exactly what I wanted since I use them with tight fitting kayak shoes. These make everything so much more pleasurable. My feet warm up really quickly after stepping into cold water and stayed nice & warm while kayaking for a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Rupp

customer_reviews.title: Must Have For Comfortable Scuba Diving
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package that these XSPA socks came in I thought that they had sent me the wrong size. They looked way too small for my giant feet. I tried them on and they fit so good I don't use my diving booties anymore.
customer_reviews.author: FunCouple

customer_reviews.title: Staying Dry wonder
customer_reviews.text: This gift was for my son who is a swim coach. Walking the pool deck, training swimmers and attending swim meets is a wet business. Because he's always getting splashed...these socks keeps his feet dry and warm. And when the weathers bad...wet feet aren't one of the problems he has to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like 'em. Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Like 'em. Better than expected. Feet warm and protected. Good fit. Hard to get off when wet...can't have everything. Great product and quality.
customer_reviews.author: DN

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic for kayaking
customer_reviews.text: These are my goto feet protectors when the temperature dips. Absolutely fantastic for kayaking. I put these on under a pair of crocs and my feet are toasty. They will wear through eventually though. I've noticed a few spots where they show signs, but I am using them in a Hobie pedal kayak. They keep me warm though.
customer_reviews.author: C.L.M.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: These are so great for snorkeling in Hawaii. They also protect you for being stuck in the foot by stepping on a sea urchin and protect your tender feet on the reefs. Fast shipping and a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Do you like your feet
customer_reviews.text: Do you like your feet? If so, these are the socks for you. Instead of your toes falling off from frostbite, you can safely use these to swim around in water with ice in it. They help quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle R Broadhead

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: First time I ordered it came on wrong size and it was easily exchanged. I love the quality and the fact that it does not allow sand to get inside.
customer_reviews.author: Yumi

customer_reviews.title: WOULD BUY AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: Wore hiking the Narrows at Zion. Worked perfectly. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BIG WALT MACHINE

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I’m normally a size 7 in shoes— go a size down in these!! I got the smallest
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice neoprene socks
customer_reviews.text: excellent for improving fit of fins that were mildly oversized. Kept feet warm as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had a chance to use them a few times since purchasing them. I wear them under a pair of water shoes while kayak fishing. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G.

customer_reviews.title: Warm Feet!
customer_reviews.text: Really warm and keeps out the water well. In 50 degree water, felt nothing. I am a 9.5 shoe and got mediums. Fit well. I got a pair of water shoes to put over. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Pug

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The socks are very comfortable and I was very happy with the delivery
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Whysong

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for whitewater or hiking in cold water
customer_reviews.text: I started to buy a more expensive version in a different brand and I'm glad I didn't these neoprene socks are perfect for summer kayaking and hiking in cold water. I put them inside my Astral Rassler shoes and my feet stay nice and toasty in cold mountain water. Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Great! Comfy an warm
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for 54 degree-ish water. Isn’t like bulky or anything. Just right!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!!
customer_reviews.text: Feet stay dry even if boots are soaked. Very thick and warm. They wash well and hang dry. I wear regular socks under these for a softer feel on my feet. A must in winter or if going into water. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Many May

customer_reviews.title: Great filler for boots to stay warm
customer_reviews.text: nice and warm and cooshy. I use them to fill the space in my boots/bindings for wakeboarding. bet they would work great for snowboard boots too, especially if you have any that have packed out
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Byrom

customer_reviews.title: Thin bottoms
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if these are normal neoprene socks, but as the sides may be 5mm, the bottoms are lucky if they are 2! Also the non skid "coating" on the bottom rubs off easily. Look for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Bigtrees

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, good-looking appearance, just right for me, but the color can be changed to a better color.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Quality build, but read reviews for size
customer_reviews.text: Haven't actually used them in the field yet, but I did try them on and wanted to help other buyers understand the sizing issue. I wear a men's' 10.5 or 11 (US) with average width. I bought the XL based on what I read here in the reviews and they fit perfectly. Snug enough to not slip, but easy to put on with no cramping. Can't wait to go fishing!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bertoli

customer_reviews.title: Great product, well made, good fit
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9-9.5 men's (US) street shoe and these Medium socks fit well. Used them canyoneering and they turned out to be much more comfortable to hike in than regular socks...hated to take them off. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: warm neoprene socks
customer_reviews.text: These keep my feet warm and drier when I go wakeboarding and wakesurfing, which is quite often. If you put the wetsuit leg over the sock they will keep the water out. I had the 2.0 ones and these are warmer. I don't like to go in the cold water without them.
customer_reviews.author: DeeDeeWillie

customer_reviews.title: good choice for warm feet
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice, thick booties. There are no drainage holes, so be sure to turn them inside out and wash with each use.
customer_reviews.author: ellen sf

customer_reviews.title: Fit is a little small
customer_reviews.text: They have a snug fit, I'm size 14 and the XXL is just a touch small. They did "break in" after a few wears and now fit pretty well. Great to wear under booties when the water's extra cold.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: I tried using them as river crossing/camp boots. They ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried using them as river crossing/camp boots. They work ok over river rock (i'm a large guy), but they don't let your feet breath at all for just after-hike, camp shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Keeping warm
customer_reviews.text: Keeps me warm swimming in the pool...50°....ugh, got anything for your face?
customer_reviews.author: John Kolasienski

customer_reviews.title: Durable, flexible, comfortable and warm!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, useful and warm enough! I used them both for sailing and scuba and pretty satisfied. I wore them while scuba diving in Hudson Bay in May as extra socks to feel warmer. Look durable and flexible to me.
customer_reviews.author: Biker

customer_reviews.title: Great Booties for SUP
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use for paddle boarding. They are comfortable and snug and kept my feet from freezing from the cool water.
customer_reviews.author: Ds

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE
customer_reviews.text: I bought a size larger than I would my shoes. These fit great, and I even wore socks under. I waded for shells after my kayak trip for about an hour and my socks were dry! I did step on a pointed rock and that hurt! The bottoms of the foot is soft, so be careful! But I didn’t slide around on slippery surfaces at all. Overall wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: F. Corrales

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my toes warm while kayaking
customer_reviews.text: Work well with sandals when kayaking. Keeps my feet from getting cold when cool weather comes around. Fit is slightly tight around the toes, but I have wide feet. We will see how they hold up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Labitt

customer_reviews.title: Great product with swim fins!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and provide some protection from ocean floor. They also worked great with the swim fins I had on. I just wished that they had a thicker and more protective rubber sole on them.
customer_reviews.author: coxm75

customer_reviews.title: They are not good for walking around in
customer_reviews.text: Work and fit well. They are not good for walking around in, the bottoms are unprotected you feel every rock through them. The neoprene is very soft, almost like gel.
customer_reviews.author: dAK

customer_reviews.title: I wear a 13.5 and an X-Large fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 13.5 and an X-Large fit perfectly. I have used them for a mug run, hunting, fishing, and washing the car. They are awesome. I just bought another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: wetsuit socks
customer_reviews.text: The small fits ladies size 6.5 well. Hope this info helps. It seems well made and I'm looking forward to using it for my next trip the Zion.
customer_reviews.author: SunChips

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy with good traction. Size XXL fit my boot size 15 D very well.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Nulty

customer_reviews.title: NeoSport Wetsuits XSPAN Socks
customer_reviews.text: Socks were of nice material. however, the tops were to tight on the ankles. They were also hard to pull on, so I had to return. If you have diabetes, or your ankles swell, I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: wildkitten

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: I walked into the Atlantic @ Cape Cod on memorial day (cold) wearing these and I stayed warm while surfing for an hour. I wear a size 10.5 (US) shoe and the large fits fine.
customer_reviews.author: Markus

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good dive socks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sock for work at the aquarium and it fits fine. Unfortunately I didn't use much of it but I do wish I could take it to the tropics to dive it.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewing for you

customer_reviews.title: Warm Feet
customer_reviews.text: I used these wakeboarding in cold spring melt run off in a river. When I pulled them off the water came out warm as did my feet. Supple and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Tim m Savage

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit. They keep my feet warm the entire ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy these 5mm booties for my Cressi gara pro LD fins. Perfect fit. They keep my feet warm the entire time in 55f water here in the Monterey bay, California. Great feel to them nice stretch. Wonderful booties.
customer_reviews.author: Fil Silva

customer_reviews.title: NeoSport Wetsuit socks.
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered other wetsuit socks who reported to be water resistant. They were not, but these are. I wear a women's size 8 to 81/2 shoe and the small sock fit me perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks!
customer_reviews.text: Kept my feet warm in 45 degree water, wasn't even chilly. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: K Cline

customer_reviews.title: need to be worn in shoes  -
customer_reviews.text: met my expectations - spent 3 days in a canoe - worked well while around 40 degrees - light duty - must be worn in shoes
customer_reviews.author: George C.

customer_reviews.title: comfy but soles don't last
customer_reviews.text: Wore these for a while. Very comfy. The soles wore out pretty soon.
customer_reviews.author: Merpet

customer_reviews.title: Great Fin Socks
customer_reviews.text: They did the job. The fit was very nice and pretty much true to size. They're comfortable; easy to put on and remove; and kept my feet warm. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: They are great! They keep your feet warm and protected
customer_reviews.text: They are great! They keep your feet warm and protected!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine M Zion

customer_reviews.title: NeoSport Wetsuit socks
customer_reviews.text: These neoprene socks kept my feet nice and warm and eliminated any rubbing from the flippers while I snorkeled in the Pacific. They worked great with the wetsuit that I had purchased. They held up well with the minimal walking I did in them and were easy to clean afterwards, too. I highly recommend them. The sizing was correct too. I am a women's 9 and my daughter is a 9 1/2 and the mediums fit great. My husband is a men's 10 and the large fit him. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Branden Muller

customer_reviews.title: ... caving for over a year now and they are amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Having been using these in rubber boots while caving for over a year now and they are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Demarest

product_meta.title: NeoSport Exclusive Mens and Women’s XSPAN Sock Available in 1.5MM or 5MM – Warm, Ideal for Surf Fishing, Water Sports and Hunting, Wear Alone or With Shoes and Boots
feature_bullets: Comfort: Soft, flexible 4 way super stretch XSPAN neoprene make this sock easy to put on and take off Perfect worn alone or under a dive boot or water shoe for extra warmth Flat seams help prevent rashes, will keep your feet comfortable for long periods
Warmth: Available in 2 thicknesses: 1.5mm and 5mm Use 1.5mm for warm water and 5mm for cold water
Grip: The bottom of the sock is coated with a thermal applied poly coating, help provide long life to a high wear sole area Excellent grip for walking on the deck, dock or shore
Durable: extremely durable and stretchy sock for all watersport and outdoor activities, for use in, on, around or under the water
Use: for use with snorkel or dive fins, water skis, wake boards, SUP’s, use under water sport boots and shoes, surfing, kayaking, Mud sports, obstacle racing and outdoor hiking
